last_response:
Common causes of postpartum depression include:

1. Hormonal changes after childbirth
2. Physical changes and recovery from delivery
3. Emotional adjustment to motherhood
4. Sleep deprivation and fatigue
5. Overwhelming feelings of responsibility
6. Changes in relationships and daily routine
7. Previous history of depression
8. Lack of support system
9. Difficult pregnancy or birth experience
10. Unrealistic expectations of motherhood

Remember: These factors don't mean you'll definitely develop PPD, but understanding them can help in prevention and early recognition.
